workflow.name: Conversational Razorpay Analytics with Google Gemini & Telegram Bot
workflow.description:
## üìù Description

Access your Razorpay insights instantly from Telegram‚Äîno dashboard, filters, or manual queries needed. Simply send messages like ‚Äúshow my payments‚Äù, ‚Äúlist recent orders‚Äù, or ‚Äúcheck refunds‚Äù, and the bot retrieves the latest information from your Razorpay merchant account in seconds.

Powered by AI, the workflow understands your message, fetches the relevant Razorpay data, and transforms it into a clear, easy-to-read summary. Everything is delivered back to you within the same Telegram chat, giving you fast, convenient, and conversational access to your business analytics.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works
### 1. Trigger ‚Äî Telegram Bot Message

The workflow starts when a user sends a message to your Telegram bot via the Telegram Trigger node.

### 2. Intent Classification

An AI model analyzes the incoming message and identifies what the user is asking for.

#### üîπ Orders Intent

Retrieves order information from Razorpay

Handles pagination and filtering logic

Uses AI to generate order summaries and insights

#### üîπ Refunds Intent

Queries Razorpay for refund events

Computes refund totals and status breakdowns

Produces formatted summaries with the AI model

#### üîπ General Chat Intent

Handles all non-transactional or fallback messages.
Useful for:


## üí° Use Cases

- Get instant Razorpay payment analytics in Telegram

 - Retrieve daily or weekly order summaries

 - View recent refund activity

 - Provide your team with quick insight access directly from chat

 - Automate repetitive Razorpay queries without dashboards

#### üß∞ Requirements

 - Razorpay API Credentials (Key ID + Key Secret) [here](http://dashboard.razorpay.com/])

 - Telegram Bot Token

#### üöÄ Setup Instructions

Import this workflow into your n8n workspace.

Add and configure your Razorpay and Telegram credentials.

Activate the workflow.

Start chatting with your Telegram bot to receive Razorpay insights on demand.

## üñºÔ∏è Workflow Components

#### This workflow includes the following nodes:

 - Telegram Trigger ‚Äì Receives user messages

 - AI Intent Classifier ‚Äì Detects what the user wants

 - Payments Processor

 - Orders Processor

 - Refunds Processor

 - General Chat Processor

 - Merge + Telegram Reply ‚Äì Sends final response

parameters.content:
# ü§ñ PayInsighter - Razorpay Analytics Bot
### **Purpose:** Intelligent Telegram bot that analyzes Razorpay payment data using AI

## **Flow:**
### 1. User sends query via Telegram
### 2. AI classifies intent (payments/orders/refunds/chat)
### 3. Routes to appropriate branch
### 4. Fetches Razorpay data
### 5. AI analyzes and formats response
### 6. Sends answer back to user

## üí° Use Cases
### Get instant Razorpay payment analytics in Telegram
### Retrieve daily or weekly order summaries
### View recent refund transactions
### Automate Razorpay queries for your team directly from chat

## üì± Entry Point

**Telegram Trigger**
- Listens for incoming Telegram messages
- Captures user queries about Razorpay analytics
- Triggers the workflow on every new message

**Output:** User message text and metadata (user ID, chat ID, etc.)

## üß† Intent Classification

**Intent Classifier**
- Analyzes user message using Google Gemini
- Classifies into 4 categories:
  ‚Ä¢ payments
  ‚Ä¢ orders
  ‚Ä¢ refunds
  ‚Ä¢ general_chat
- Supports multi-intent (e.g., "orders_payments")

**Output:** Single word or underscore-separated intents

## üîÄ Routing Logic

**4 IF Nodes (Parallel Routing)**
- If: Checks if intent contains "payments"
- If1: Checks if intent contains "refunds"
- If2: Checks if intent contains "orders"
- If3: Checks if intent contains "general_chat"

**Note:** Multiple branches can execute simultaneously for multi-intent queries

## üí≥ Payments Branch

**Step 1: Payments Processor (AI Agent)**
- Parses user query for date ranges
- Generates JSON with from/to/skip/count parameters
- Date format: "2025-11-07 00:00:00"

**Step 2: Fetch all payments (Razorpay API)**
- Calls Razorpay API with generated parameters
- Retrieves payment records

**Step 3: AI Agent3 (Response Formatter)**
- Analyzes payment data
- Generates concise, user-friendly answer
- Avoids data table flooding

## üì¶ Orders Branch

**Step 1: Orders (AI Agent)**
- Parses user query for date ranges
- Generates JSON with from/to/skip/count parameters
- Max count: 100 records

**Step 2: Fetch all orders (Razorpay API)**
- Calls Razorpay Orders API
- Retrieves order records

**Step 3: AI Agent1 (Response Formatter)**
- Analyzes order data
- Generates concise answer as PayInsighter bot
- Focuses on what user asked

## üí∞ Refunds Branch

**Step 1: Refunds (AI Agent)**
- Parses user query for date ranges
- Generates JSON with epoch timestamps
- Parameters: from/to/skip/count

**Step 2: Fetch all refunds (Razorpay API)**
- Calls Razorpay Refunds API
- Retrieves refund records

**Step 3: AI Agent2 (Response Formatter)**
- Analyzes refund data
- Generates concise answer
- Maintains PayInsighter bot persona

## üí¨ General Chat Branch

**General Chat Processor (AI Agent)**
- Handles non-analytics queries
- Responds as PayInsighter bot
- Provides helpful, concise answers
- No Razorpay API calls needed

**Use Cases:**
- Greetings
- Help requests
- General questions about the bot
- Clarifications

## üîó Response Consolidation

**Merge Node**
- Combines outputs from all 4 branches
- Handles multi-intent responses
- Appends mode: preserves all responses

**Send a text message (Telegram)**
- Sends final AI-generated response
- Uses original chat ID from trigger
- Completes the conversation loop

parameters.content:
## ü§ñ AI Model Provider

**Google Gemini Chat Model**
- Model: gemini-2.5-flash (Or any other model)
- Powers all 8 AI agents in workflow
- Handles:
  ‚Ä¢ Intent classification
  ‚Ä¢ Query parameter extraction
  ‚Ä¢ Data analysis
  ‚Ä¢ Response generation

**Connected to:** All AI Agent nodes

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
